repo.name: anyquery
repo.description: Query anything (GitHub, Notion, +40 more) with SQL and let LLMs (ChatGPT, Claude) connect to using MCP

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and installation coverage with good quick-start examples, but lacks inline configuration details and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common issues like connection errors, plugin installation failures, or permission problems

injection_risks.description: Potential SQL injection risk due to the use of strconv.ParseInt with user input
Hardcoded 'Bot ' string in discordgo.New function call, potential for token manipulation

critical_findings: Potential SQL injection risk in plugins/click_up/main.go
Hardcoded 'Bot ' string in discordgo.New function call in plugins/discord/main.go
security.summary: The codebase has several security concerns, including potential SQL injection risks and hardcoded API tokens, which require immediate attention to prevent exploitation.

common_complaints: Plugin crashes with 'could not request the rows from the plugin' errors
Stale/cached data returned after external updates
Date/datetime format inconsistencies in Notion plugin
praise_themes: Innovative tool design (query multiple data sources with one tool)
sentiment.summary: Community is moderately healthy with active maintenance, but faces recurring plugin stability issues and data consistency bugs that frustrate users despite appreciation for the core product concept.

red_flags: Some issues were marked as stale without further investigation or feedback
Lack of detailed responses for some specific queries
communication.summary: The maintainer is generally helpful and patient, with clear explanations, but could improve by addressing more specific user questions and maintaining consistent follow-up.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months despite last commit being from November 2025
8 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No closed issues in the past 6 months indicates lack of maintenance
No merged PRs in the past 6 months
No active contributors in the past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release cycle may be broken
positive_signals: Project exists and has some issue tracking in place
maintenance.summary: The anyquery package appears stale with no development activity, issue resolution, or contributor engagement over the past 6 months.

project_metrics.description: Query anything (GitHub, Notion, +40 more) with SQL and let LLMs (ChatGPT, Claude) connect to using MCP

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but lacks comprehensive examples and troubleshooting guidance.
